reviewText: The least they could do is leave an empty slot for the upcoming film. It's 9 months away and theyre trying to sell us some lame collection. Why is the collection lame? Because it comes with Wolverines freaking hand and claws...cool. Could have been literally anything else. Magnetos helmet? Xaviers school? A Brian Cox bust? Nope. They cut off Logans hand and stuck it on some crappy box.Even worse than leaving out the sequel to first class is the fact that they are forcing you to buy Xmen 3 and Origins.
summary: Did they forget about Days of Future Past?

Title: X-Men: The Adamantium Collection

reviewText: My partner and I love the X-men series (with the exception of X-men 3...) and when the price dropped on this set, we snatched it up (replacing several films we had the DVD versions for).  Biggest plus?  It contains the new 'Wolverine' film - which was nearly as expensive as this set when they were released.The one fact to note:  this is a BARGAIN set!  So the discs are from previous printings of the films.  So they weren't pressed for this collection specifically, but were unpackaged or unsold discs from other sets.  The films included are:X-men (2000)X-2 (2003)X-men Last Stand (2006)X-Men Origins: Wolverine (2009)X-Men First Class (2011)The Wolverine (2013)Of course everyone has their favorites, but I was blown away by First Class since I had noticed a decline with Last Stand.  Wolverine was also a shockingly good X-men film.
summary: Great Blu-Ray collection for X-men fans!
Title: X-Men: The Adamantium Collection

reviewText: X-Men and the Wolverine Collection is a great price for all six movies in a Blu-ray format.  The box set collection comes with awesome cover art on each disk.  With this combo pack you get the original first three x-men movies ( X-Men, X2, and X-Men: The Last Stand).  Also within this combo you get X-Men: First Class, The Wolverine, and X-Men Origins: Wolverine.  This combo pack would be a great holiday gift for someone you care about, or maybe for yourself as well.  If you are not familiar with these films I have included a quick summary of each movie.- X-Men is a 2000 Co-written and directed by Bryan Singer, the film stars Patrick Stewart, Hugh Jackman, Ian McKellen, Anna Paquin, Famke Janssen, Bruce Davison, James Marsden, Halle Berry, Rebecca Romijn, Ray Park and Tyler Mane.  It depicts a world in which a small proportion of people are mutants, whose possession of superhuman powers makes them distrusted by normal humans.  The film focuses on the mutants Wolverine and Rogue as they are brought into a conflict between two groups that have radically different approaches to bringing about the acceptance of mutantkind: Professor Xavier's X-Men, and the Brotherhood of Mutants, led by Magneto.X2 is a 2003 American superhero film, based on the fictional characters the X-Men.  Directed by Bryan Singer, and stars Patrick Stewart, Hugh Jackman, Ian McKellen, Alan Cumming, Famke Janssen, Anna Paquin, Shawn Ashmore, Aaron Stanford, Brian Cox, Rebecca Romijn-Stamos, James Marsden, Halle Berry and Kelly Hu. The plot, inspired by the graphic novel God Loves, Man Kills, pits the X-Men and their enemies, the Brotherhood, against the genocidal Colonel William Stryker (Brian Cox).  He leads an assault on Professor Xavier's school to build his own version of Xavier's mutant-tracking computer Cerebro, in order to destroy every mutant on Earth.X-Men: The Last Stand is a 2006 American superhero film that was directed by Brett Ratner and stars Hugh Jackman and Halle Berry. The film's script is loosely based on two X-Men comic book story arcs, "The Dark Phoenix Saga" by writer Chris Claremont and artist John Byrne, and "Gifted" by writer Joss Whedon and artist John Cassaday, with a plot that revolves around a "mutant cure" that causes serious repercussions among mutants and humans, and on the resurrection of Jean Grey.- Men Origins: Wolverine is a 2009 origin story for wolverine.  This film is directed by Gavin Hood and produced by and starring Hugh Jackman.  It co-stars Liev Schreiber, Lynn Collins, Taylor Kitsch, will.i.am, Kevin Durand, Dominic Monaghan, Daniel Henney and Ryan Reynolds.  The film is a prequel focusing on the violent past of the mutant Wolverine and his relationship with his half-brother Victor Creed.  The plot details Wolverine's childhood as James Howlett (Troye Sivan), his early encounters with Major William Stryker, his time with Team X, and the bonding of Wolverine's skeleton with the indestructible metal adamantium during the Weapon X program.X-Men: First Class is a 2011 American superhero film. The film was directed by Matthew Vaughn and produced by Bryan Singer, and acts as a prequel to the X-Men film series.  The story is set primarily in 1962 during the Cuban Missile Crisis, and focuses on the relationship between Charles Xavier (Professor X) and Erik Lensherr (Magneto), and the origin of their groups--the X-Men and the Brotherhood of Mutants, respectively. The film stars James McAvoy as Xavier and Michael Fassbender as well as Kevin Bacon, January Jones, Rose Byrne, Jennifer Lawrence, and Zo Kravitz.The Wolverine is a 2013 is the sixth installment in the X-Men film series and the second film headlining Wolverine after X-Men Origins: Wolverine in 2009.  Hugh Jackman reprises his role from previous films as the title character, with James Mangold directing a screenplay written by Scott Frank and Mark Bomback, with uncredited parts by Christopher McQuarrie, based on the 1982 limited series Wolverine by Chris Claremont and Frank Miller. In the film, which follows the events of X-Men: The Last Stand, Logan travels to Japan, where he engages an old acquaintance in a struggle that has lasting consequences. Stripped of his immortality, Wolverine must battle deadly samurai as well as his inner demons.Thank you for reading my review, if you have any questions feel free to email me, I would be happy to help you with any questions you have.
summary: X-Men and the Wolverine Collection is an amazing box set
Title: X-Men: The Adamantium Collection

Title: X-Men: The Adamantium Collection

reviewText: I absolutely loved the X-Men growing up.  I still remember reading the comics, collecting the cards and watching the Saturday Morning cartoons in pure joy.  When the X-Men came out in theaters in 2000 I was ecstatic.  And since then the love has not changed.  So when the Adamantium Collection came out I had to have it.  And it is worth every penny to me (my opinion).  Anyone who loves the X-Men and Wolverine as much as I do, this Collection is for you.  It has every X-Men movie and Wolverine movie, as well as an open spot for X-Men Days of Future Past.  Must buy for Huge X-Men fans!

reviewText: This product is all five movies but only the theatrical versions of the films. No special editions or special features. They literally took each disc from the blu-ray cases of the original packaged stand alone titles, for each movie, and put them in one special blu-ray box. So you will see the phrase "disc one" on almost each of the discs. So no special features or extra content.Aside from that, this honestly was a great deal. I bought this on sale at about $29.99. Honestly it is worth it to have all 5 movies for such a low price, which is about $6 a bluray movie.I preordered the following for a complete XMEN collection:http://www.amazon.com/gp/product/B00K7IPGS6?ie=UTF8&camp;=213733&creative;=393185&creativeASIN;=B00K7IPGS6&linkCode;=shr&tag;=swiclu-20&linkId;=J6AEXYKWSF3T353LCheers!
summary: Worth to have all 5 movies for $29.99, is about $6 a bluray movie

Title: X-Men: The Adamantium Collection

reviewText: I was so angry when I opened the package. I knew something was wrong when it felt so light in my hands.I mean, obviously I didn't buy this for the movies, who hasn't watched all the movies already? Duh? I thought it would be great to add to my "Everything Hugh Jackman" collection in my garage.FIRST, unlike what was described on the box, I DO NOT SEE ANY ADAMANTIUM ANYWHERE. Did I get a dud, or is this a blatant rip-off?? I knew $129 was too good to be true, when an extremely rare metal like adamantium would probably cost more than its weight in gold.SECOND, after sniffing the claw, I do not smell any of Jackman's sweat. Is this even an authentic Wolverine claw? On close inspection, I did not even find a single strand of body hair or skin flake.I am thinking of returning the package when my cousin returns the discs after finishing the last movie.
Title: X-Men: The Adamantium Collection

reviewText: Love all of these movies.  Hugh Jackman is amazing!!!! Great price for so many movies.
Title: X-Men: The Adamantium Collection

reviewText: Update 12-24-2013:I just got the claw package for my younger brother's gift, so now I can review both theAdamantium Collectionand theX-Men and the Wolverine Collection. To be honest, I had every intention to keep the claw for myself, but I guess I am getting too old, and it didn't help that the claw is not as extra ordinary as I would like it to be. I think this package is not worth the list price. It would be a nice product if the list price was around $80, because the quality of the claw and the stand is too cheap for the hefty list price. If you forget about the price, it will be a nice package, and the new printed labels for all the discs are nicer than previous releases. The claw is a little smaller than what I thought it would be; precisely, it is 15" tall and 6.5" wide. The discs contents are the same as theX-Men and the Wolverine Collectionthat I previously got, but there is one extra disc called Legacy X. Legacy X disc is about one hour, and it has 6 short clips that are exclusive to the Adamantium package: X-Men, X2, X-Men Last Stand, Wolverine, X-Men First class, and "What's Next." These clips go through the history of casting and making of the X-Men universe.Update 12-11-2013:My review was for theX-Men and the Wolverine Collection. You know, the normal one with 6 bare discs and no bells and whistles. Amazon has merged my review and many others' into other products like the claw package and Adamantium collection, and theirs into the Wolverine collection!! It is a mess I know, and I think is misleading. If you are reading any review on any of these items, you probably need to track which product the review is written for.Original Review:I got this the other day. First impression, it doesn't look anything like other box sets like TDK Trilogy; precisely, the box is too narrow/thin. The picture here has an impression that the box is at least one inches in depth, but the whole box is almost as thick as a normal BD case. You can see the pictures I've uploaded for more details.The cover artwork of this box set looks the same as the normalAdamantium Collection(not thelimited claw package); however unlike Adamantium, there is nothing special about this set. You only get 6 bare/plain discs. They have the same artwork as the individual discs previously found in earlier X-Men releases, so nothing special here either. There is only one disc for each movie, so don't expect special features and extras from this set. The Wolverine is only in 2D version, and it is not the uncut/unleashed version.There is one strange issue with this box set. When I first got home, I noticed 4 spots an inch from each corner in the back of the box set cover. The two top-left and top-right ones are more pronounced, and they look like water/oil leakages half an inch in diameter. I didn't open the first box, and went to another BB store to exchange it. They had 9 available, but to my surprise, they all had this leakage problem. They were almost in the same spot, but different patterns. Upon close inspection, I noticed that there is something inside the cardboard that has a bumpy feeling to the touch. My guess is, underneath the cardboard there are security devices or glue or something that have exploded or over leaked. Since all the 10 boxes that I examined had this problem, if you are too picky about your box sets, make sure you can return the item if needed. You can also go to a store and check this out yourself.Overall, even with the leakage spots, I kept the box set. I didn't own any of these movies in Blu-ray format, and buying them separately would've cost a little more. Of course, if you buy them separately, you will end up with two discs or three discs sets which will contain extras and bonuses. My first idea was to get theX-Men Trilogy box set, and then get the First Class, Origins, and The Wolverine separately. It would end up being a little more than this box set, but I would have had all the bonus features. I changed my mind at the end, because having all these movies in a one small package is more convenient, and the next X-Men movie is due for next year, so there will be more appealing box sets soon.List of Special Features:X-Men: Audio Commentary by Bryan SingerX2: Audio Commentary Bryan Singer + Marvel Universe TrailersX-Men Last Stand: Audio Commentary + Marvel Universe Trailers + Deleted Scenes
Title: X-Men: The Adamantium Collection

Title: X-Men: The Adamantium Collection

reviewText: The X-Men film series is one of the best comic book/superhero adaptations ever put on film. Since the series debuted with the first film in 2000, there have been 7 films to date.This set compiles the first 6 films (X-Men, X2: X-Men United, X-Men: The Last Stand, X-Men Origins: Wolverine, X-Men First Class, and the Wolverine.) The only film not included is Days of Future Past, which as of the time I am writing this, is still in theaters.It is a pretty bare bones package but it gets the job done. Individual bonus discs from earlier reissues are not included; each film is one disc only and only has what bonus features were included on the same disc as the movie itself. While I would liked to have had all of these features in the set, it is likely going to mean very little to people that just want to get and watch the movies, which is precisely who this set will appeal to.The other problem is that the Wolverine is the theatrical PG-13 cut, and not the unrated Director's Cut version. I wish they would have included both cuts of the movie; currently you can only get the Director's cut in the Deluxe Sex of the Wolverine that has the main film in 3D (and the Director's Cut, even in that set, is just 2D. Go figure.) Still, no arguing that the Director's Cut should have been included here.If you are a fan of the X-Men films, this set is often on sale on here for a low, affordable price you should not pass up. It's the cheapest, quickest, and easiest way to get all of the movies to date on home video in one place, flaws aside.
summary: Great value, but missing Director's Cut of the Wolverine and older bonus content.
Title: X-Men: The Adamantium Collection
